title: Why are computers electronic devices? - Quora

response.answer_text: Electronics comprises the physics, engineering, technology and applications that deal with the emission, flow and control of electrons in vacuum and matter. This is an apt if vague description of the underlying technology that enables computers to function. And thus computers fall into the much broader category of electronics. At least for electronic computers. There are mechanical computer systems that would not be considered an electronic device, but they’re not computers we’d use today.
